text:
Starting with small, low-stakes copywriting contracts through platforms like Upwork or through reaching out on slack channels like these.

Something I look for in copywriting freelancers is a base-level understanding of marketing. Like what the goals of the copy are and how to get there.

In the context of my work. I need copywriters to support me in writing blog posts for B2B saas. So I need the writer to understand that blogs are typically top of funnel educational pieces for my target audience... with possibly a slight plug of my product.

Another thing would be to have a super base-level understanding of SEO (I'd say that this would increase the rate that she can charge). So, keywords, secondary keywords, external and internal links, etc. Nothing too technical.

Lastly, setting up her linkedin or a tiny website with some sample writing that shows a variety of what she can do. I typically wouldn't choose a writer that has never written in the B2B space.

Let me know if she has any questions. :slightly_smiling_face: Happy to help further -- I know this can be a little intimidating for someone coming in cold!!

text:
I moved from marketing to running my own copywritimg biz for the last 2 years, to now a full time copy position.

The best thing for me was being in The Copywriter Club on facebook and making friends with other writers in the niche I wrote for. You would trade off jobs if you're busy, and can offer to sub for someone more experienced to build up more experience (although, unfortunately, not samples). Depends what matters to her!
